title: Read the statement from Arthur T. Demoulas’s camp after Market Basket firing
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Arthur T. Demoulas was fired as Market Basket CEO after a vote by company board members on Tuesday night.
Demoulas's spokesperson alleged his firing was predetermined and criticized the board's investigation as a cover-up.
The firing occurred amid a corporate feud with his sisters, who hold majority control of Market Basket.

title: Here’s why you’ll likely see long lines at Anna’s Taqueria locations today
author: John Waller
bullets: Anna's Taqueria celebrates 30 years with $3.50 super burritos, available in-store and online for one day only.
The promotion offers 1995 prices on Wednesday, September 10, at all Anna's Taqueria locations.
Anna's Taqueria has expanded from its Brookline origins to 10 locations, including Woburn and Natick.

title: Patriots rookie TreVeyon Henderson announces engagement
author: John Waller
bullets: Patriots rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson announced his engagement on Instagram, sharing a photo with his fiancée.
The announcement followed Henderson's successful year, including a national championship and a climb in fantasy football rankings.
Henderson's teammate, quarterback Drake Maye, recently married Ann Michael Hudson, potentially offering wedding planning advice.

title: Red Sox rookie Connelly Early discussed his dominant MLB debut
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox rookie Connelly Early pitched five scoreless innings and struck out 11 in his MLB debut against the Athletics.
Early's debut tied a team record for most strikeouts by a rookie and helped Boston secure a 6-0 victory.
His strong performance came with support from Carlos Narváez as Boston aims for a playoff spot.

title: One injured in Boston scaffolding collapse
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A construction worker was injured in a scaffolding collapse inside a building in Boston's South End on Tuesday.
The worker was rescued from the third floor using Tower 10 and transported to a hospital for concussion protocol.
The Occupational Safety and Health Administration is investigating the cause of the accident with local building inspectors.

title: Market Basket board votes to remove Arthur T. Demoulas
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket board unanimously voted to remove CEO Arthur T. Demoulas after months of corporate conflict.
Board accuses Demoulas of ignoring directives and planning a work stoppage, putting company interests secondary.
Board filed in Delaware Court to finalize his removal; Demoulas contests termination amid family feud.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Sept. 10)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: 27 Camp St, Abington: One-family Cape Cod, 2,265 sq ft, 4 bedrooms, sold for $710,000 on a 26,988 sq ft lot.
50 Seminole Road, Acton: One-family Colonial, 1,470 sq ft, 4 bedrooms, 2 baths, sold for $850,000 on a 21,000 sq ft lot.
5 Wingate St, Amesbury: One-family Colonial, 2,674 sq ft, 4 bedrooms, 3 baths, sold for $850,000 on a 10,358 sq ft lot.

title: Here’s who will be on the ballot in November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: November 4 general election ballot finalized after Boston's preliminary elections on September 9.
Ruthzee Louijeune is the frontrunner in the at-large city councilor race with 18.71% of votes.
District 1 incumbent Gabriela Coletta Zapata leads with 76.77% of votes, advancing to general election.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu advances to November election with 45 percentage point lead over Josh Kraft in preliminary results.
Nearly 18% voter turnout recorded with over 75,000 ballots cast, according to the Boston Elections Department.
Candidates Robert Cappucci and Domingos DaRosa eliminated from mayoral race after failing to advance past preliminary election.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Cindy Bi, a venture capitalist, sued surrogate Rebecca Smith after a miscarriage, accusing her of killing the child.
Bi and Smith's initially positive relationship soured as Bi increasingly pressured and publicly targeted Smith online.
Smith faced harassment, job changes, and financial strain due to Bi's actions, prompting her to file a restraining order.
